required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence Rate, and Clinical Characteristics of Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome Via Screening Patients Admitted to Medical Intensive Care Units
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence Rate, and Clinical Characteristics of Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome Via Screening Patients Admitted to Medical Intensive Care Units

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective observation study to screen adult obese (BMI ≥30 kg/m2) patients who were newly admitted to the medical intensive care units and turned out to be diagnosed as Obesity hypoventilation syndrome(OHS). The investigators purpose is to look into the prevalence, predictive factors, and outcomes of OHS in these critically ill patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of obesity hypoventilation syndrome in Asian critically ill patients
primary_outcome.description: Detecting obesity hypoventilation syndrome via screening obesity(BMI>=30kg/m^2) in critical care units in Asian.

study_pop.textblock: adult obese (BMI ≥30 kg/m2) patients who were newly admitted to the medical intensive care units and turned out to be diagnosed as obesity hypoventilation syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2
- Suspected chronic hypercapnia as following Paco2 ≥ 45 mmHg, HCO3- ≥ 27mEq/L or base excess, BE ≥ 2 mEq/L
Exclusion Criteria:
- Malignancy with lung involvement
- Autoimmune disease with lung involvement
- Moderate to severe obstructive respiratory pattern via spirometry
- Uncontrolled endocrine disease
- Pregnancy
- Pneumonia confirmed by image
- Out-of-hospital cardiac arrest
- Lung edema
- Foreigner of Taiwan
